name: Baked Barley
headline: Baked Barley
keywords: Easy Side Dish Recipes,Side Dish,Easy Lunch Recipes,Lunch,American,Grain Recipes,Rice Recipes,Barley,High Fiber

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.

Place the barley into a 1 1/2-quart ceramic or glass baking dish (with a lid) and add the butter, salt and boiling water. Stir to combine. Cover the dish tightly with aluminum foil and place the lid on top of the foil. Bake on the middle rack of the oven for 1 hour.
After 1 hour, remove the cover, fluff with a fork and serve immediately.

review.reviewBody: I use beef  broth or chicken  even veggie stock. I add chopped up carrots. And celery- whatever veggies I have laying around

I seem to be in the minority here.  I used Bob's Red Mill Hull-Less Barley.  I know there is hulled, hull-less, and pearl barley.  So I am wondering that even though the recipe calls for hulled barley, are you using pearl barley?  I understand that the end result should be chewy, but after 1 hour in the oven using the exact instructions, the barley was still hard as a rock and the water was not absorbed.  Can someone help me figure out what I am doing wrong?  Thank you!

For a richer, vitiamin A enriched side dish, try  taking a 32oz carton of no sodium stock (chicken or beef) Add -2 carrots cut in thirds, 1 onion cut in fourths, 2stalks celery, 1small bay leaf, few sprigs of thyme 2-3 garlic cloves. Bring up to a boil.Reuce heat and simmer till reduced down to 2 C..Remove veggies( I toss them out b/c I have by then used up both the flavor and the vitiamins ) I then use this 2 Cups in the barley recipe. Sometimes, when finished,I stir in some sauted mushrooms, onion an some frozen peas ...sometimes, not.No matter how you make this, MAKE DOUBLE...IT FREEZES WELL I freeze this in small zip locks for other uses

Love this recipe. I use broth and add veggies (carrot, celery, onion in the food processor, sometimes frozen peas) and a seasoning (curry, Italian or your favorite blend). Always comes out perfect and is a kid-pleaser!

This si a very simple recipe. I changed it a little. I did 1 cup of boiling water and 1 cup go boiling chicken broth.I also added 1/4 cup fresh broccoli, 1/4 cup diced yellow onion, and 1/4 cup frozen carrots (I did not have fresh ones). I also baked it a little longer, I did 1hr and 30 minutes. If you want it more juicy add more chicken broth. It was delicious and easy.
Hit this with some truffle oil after baking for an awesome experience.
So easy. I have a curse when it comes to cooking grains such as rice and barley--always underdone + crunchy or burnt. THANK YOU ALTON!

Perfect. I fell in love with barley recently when making a mushroom soup. I decided to try it as a side dish. I was pleasantly surprised at it's texture, (looking for a healthier alternative to pasta and rice.) I'm happy that I came upon this recipe, since it couldn't be easier. It turned out perfectly. No fuss, no muss and a perfect texture!

You don't need the butter if looking for a healther version. Instead of 2 Cups Water I used 1 Cup Water and 1 Cup low sodium low fat chicken broth.

I will reheat throughout the week and throw in various combinations of baby spinach, mushrooms, onions, green onions.

I think I might even try it once with beef broth.

The cooking method is just so easy!

Thanks Alton!

I've never cooked barley before, so this was a first for me.  So yummy!  I added some sauteed onions and garlic, some fresh dill, and some crushed red pepper flakes, then followed the cooking directions.  Turned out perfect!  Also, I did some research on the nutritional value of barley (I'm battling colon cancer).  Turns out, barley prevents cancer cells from being "energetic".  Thanks Alton!!

Excellent!
I made it with 1c boiling water and 1c boiling chicken broth. Served it with a skillet chicken with apples, onions and cranberries that has a spicy apple juice-based sauce. Delicious!

I just use a Pyrex 11x7 glass dish and put foil tightly over. I feed vegans and this is a DELICIOUS variation: 1 c. veggie broth + 1 c. water, 1 T Earth Balance (fake) butter, and added 2 T of flax meal. 'Twas DELISH!
So simple and so good what a way to eat Barley. I have enough left to try mixing milk,sugar,vanilla and a few raisins in it for dessert.

This is stupid easy.  I love it!  Have made it several times and it turns out perfectly.  A great base to lay a braised brisket and it's lovely juices  over.  A nice change from rice and mashed potatoes.

I love this dish. Even with basic ingredients and not many spices
It is very satisfying and tastes great. I make this at least once
a week
This is such a simple recipe and a great beginning to even tastier food.

I sauteed some chopped onions, garlic, an sliced mushrooms. My oven must run high, because it didn't take an hour. I could smell the barley and onions, so I took a peek and added a little more water. I also added about a 1/2 tsp of huhner,[ bought it in Germany} or chicken bouillon to the barley and extra add ins. This is great!
easy recipe for perfect barley
We love this recipe. SImple, cheap and healthy!

I suffer from low blood sugar and I've learned that the best foods for me to prevent low blood sugar dips are fiber-rich foods, especially carbohydrates. Recently, I bought a box of barley with the intention of learning to use it to help with the hypoglycemia. I'm not a fan of boiled barley but I was resigned to eating it, nonetheless. Then I happened upon this recipe and I really have to thank Alton for sharing.

In my oven, following the directions exactly, a crun-chewy texture resulted -- which I love. My first bite was a disappointment. I was expecting more flavor as a stand-alone dish. It has a mild, bland, nutty flavor. With each bite, my appreciation grew. I liked the slight buttery feel in the mouth -- but I think that I will use a little less butter next time. I think that I'll also try baking it with broth and mushrooms, too.

As I understand it, the only source of fuel for our brains is blood sugar. When the blood sugar dips, brain function decreases, moodiness and depression become a problem and fatigue sets in. If it drops low enough, unconsciousness can occur. When I eat foods that are fiber rich, my quality of life improves instantly and is maintained over a longer period of time so that I don't have to eat again to raise my blood sugar before I'm even hungry. I can feel my mind becoming more alert and my mood improving by the minute when I eat the right foods. Thanks, Alton, for helping to improve my quality of life and providing me with one more weapon in my food armory!
I'll make it all the time!
I love this recipe!!  I used it to make the Barley-Black Bean recipe that is listed on here and it works perfect!!!  Super easy and tasty!!!
I cannot believe how well this turned out. It is so easy to make a batch and hold it in the frig for different uses. Great!!!

I used a little more water.
Put in 1/2 a fresh jalapeno and instead of the salt a cube of chicken bullion.
Also skipped the butter, no need for it. Came out great!!!
Great different choice that rice or pasta.
Also...no burt food on the bottom of the pan!!! No stirring!!
This recipe couldn't be easier nor tastier!  I have never had barley that was so yummy - this method gives it a deep nutty flavor!  Thanks, Alton!
Best barley ever,oven method far superior to stove top. H20 amt. & bake time perfect! Excellent with a little celery seed & cayenne pepper.
Before I found this recipe the only one I could find was for boiling it on the stove top. That never worked. This is fool proof. I love it and use it all the time.

i prepare this recipe with long grain brown rice instead of barley, and microwave in a covered bundt pan on power level 2 (after the water has come to a boil) for an hour... am anxious to substitute barley for rice, should be a welcome variation on the same theme for this wannabe vegetarian.
